To tackle our nation's burden of debt, tough decisions and careful solutions are required. But the solutions must include reforms to save and sustain the mandatory programs serving many vulnerable Americans.

The federal government does not have a revenue problem, it has a mandatory spending problem. In 1965, mandatory accounted for 34% of the budget. Last year, it made up more than two-thirds. By 2028, that figure is projected to reach 77%. https://twitter.com/TomColeOK04/status/1108172968037924864¬†‚Ä¶

In Oklahoma, where our election system is seen as highly successful and widely recognized, #HR1's proposed mandates would needlessly increase the cost of elections statewide and in every county.

#HR1 would disrupt and infringe upon the role states play in conducting their own elections. While some states are clearly more successful than others, it is alarming that Democrats want to force our 50 separate and unique states to operate under the same guidelines.
